metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6888 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An error in the "read_metadata_vorbiscomment_()" function (src/libFLAC/stream_decoder.c) in FLAC version 1.3.2 can be exploited to cause a memory leak via a specially crafted FLAC file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

flac - 1.3.2-1ubuntu0.1
libflac++6v5 - 1.3.2-1ubuntu0.1
libflac8 - 1.3.2-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code is different in chromium-browser, doesn't look affected

criterions.comment: flac package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.2-1ubuntu0.1').
praat: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
